channel.title: Comments on: Perl, Python, PHP, LAMP get mad play on Gillmor Gang

item.title: by: Ryan Tomayko
item.description:
I'm not extactly sure although Hummer Winblad is one of two venturists putting up the cash for ActiveGrid to move forward.

http://www.activegrid.com/news/pressrelease-111704.php

I guess I could call them and ask...
item.content:encoded:
I’m not extactly sure although Hummer Winblad is one of two venturists putting up the cash for ActiveGrid to move forward.

http://www.activegrid.com/news/pressrelease-111704.php

I guess I could call them and ask…

item.title: by: Rich Manalang
item.description: So... what company is the VC referring to? ActiveGrid?
item.content:encoded: So… what company is the VC referring to? ActiveGrid?

item.title: by: Ryan Tomayko
item.description:
And, here's a link to the June 24, 2005 Gillmor Gang from Gnomedex 5. Pretty impressive cast, in fact.

http://gillmorgang.podshow.com/?p=8

I'm in the midst of getting this queued up now.
item.content:encoded:
And, here’s a link to the June 24, 2005 Gillmor Gang from Gnomedex 5. Pretty impressive cast, in fact.

http://gillmorgang.podshow.com/?p=8

I’m in the midst of getting this queued up now.

item.title: by: Ryan Tomayko
item.description:
Okay it turns out I was completely inaccurate in almost every way.

  1. Episode was from June 18, 2004 and so is definitely not the "latest".
  2. The special guest is Mitchell Kertzman
  3. The link was wrong.

My bad on this. Dan was talking about recording a recent Gillmor Gang at Gnomedex just a few weeks ago and when I saw the "June 16" in iTunes, I figured that was it.

Again, sorry for the error.

It may be interesting to dig a little and find out what company it was that they were investing in and what ended up happening to it. Anyone know off the top of their head?
item.content:encoded:
Okay it turns out I was completely inaccurate in almost every way.

  1. Episode was from June 18, 2004 and so is definitely not the “latest”.
  2. The special guest is Mitchell Kertzman
  3. The link was wrong.

My bad on this. Dan was talking about recording a recent Gillmor Gang at Gnomedex just a few weeks ago and when I saw the “June 16″ in iTunes, I figured that was it.

Again, sorry for the error.

It may be interesting to dig a little and find out what company it was that they were investing in and what ended up happening to it. Anyone know off the top of their head?

item.title: by: Ryan Tomayko
item.description: Hmmm. You're right. The link to IT Conversations is from February. I'm pulling the June 18 ep. from the podcast directory in iTunes. It's under "ITC: Digital Rights Management" for some reason. Let me see if I can dig up the link...
item.content:encoded: Hmmm. You’re right. The link to IT Conversations is from February. I’m pulling the June 18 ep. from the podcast directory in iTunes. It’s under “ITC: Digital Rights Management” for some reason. Let me see if I can dig up the link…

item.title: by: Simon Willison
item.description: I can't find the episode from June 18th - the latest one listed on the site is February 4th, which does feature Dan Bricklin but doesn't appear to include the content you quoted (although I haven't yet listened to the whole thing).
item.content:encoded: I can’t find the episode from June 18th - the latest one listed on the site is February 4th, which does feature Dan Bricklin but doesn’t appear to include the content you quoted (although I haven’t yet listened to the whole thing).
